pullRequest.body:
We prove several results involving partial sums of coefficients (or norm of coefficients) of  L-series. 

The two main results of this PR are:

- `LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO`: for `f : â„• â†’ â„‚`, if the partial sums `âˆ‘ k âˆˆ Icc 1 n, â€–f kâ€–` are `O(n ^ r)` for some real `0 â‰¤ r`, then the L-series `Lseries f` converges at `s : â„‚` for all `s` such that `r < s.re`.

- `LSeries_eq_mul_integral` : for `f : â„• â†’ â„‚`, if the partial sums `âˆ‘ k âˆˆ Icc 1 n, f k` are `O(n ^ r)` for some real `0 â‰¤ r` and the L-series `LSeries f` converges at `s : â„‚` with `r < s.re`, then `LSeries f s = s * âˆ« t in Set.Ioi 1, (âˆ‘ k âˆˆ Icc 1 âŒŠtâŒ‹â‚Š, f k) * t ^ (- (s + 1))`.

More results will be proved in #20660 

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.SpecificAsymptotics | 1351 | 1373 | +22 (+1.63%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Polynomial.Basic`|19|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.SpecificAsymptotics`|22|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.SumCoeff` (new file)|2147|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Asymptotics.isEquivalent_nat_ceil`
`+ Asymptotics.isEquivalent_nat_floor`
`+ Complex.deriv_norm_ofReal_cpow_eq`
`+ IsBigO.mul_atTop_rpow_natCast_of_isBigO_rpow`
`+ IsBigO.mul_atTop_rpow_of_isBigO_rpow`
`+ LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO`
`+ LSeriesSummable_of_sum_norm_bigO_and_nonneg`
`+ LSeries_eq_mul_integral`
`+ LSeries_eq_mul_integral'`
`+ LSeries_eq_mul_integral_of_nonneg`
`+ _root_.integrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`
`+ cpow_ne_zero_iff`
`+ cpow_ne_zero_iff_of_exponent_ne_zero`
`+ integrableAtFilter_rpow_atTop_iff`
`+ integrableOn_Ioi_deriv_norm_ofReal_cpow`
`+ integrableOn_deriv_ofReal_cpow`
`+ locallyIntegrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`
`+ ne_zero_of_re_pos`
`+ norm_ofReal_cpow_eventually_eq_atTop`
`+ range_succ_eq_Icc_zero`
`+ re_neg_ne_zero_of_re_pos`
`+ term_defâ‚€`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19944~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> I am not sure it is a good idea to have so many `private` declarations. When I first started contributing to mathlib, I was told that `private` was banned entirely; the rules have been relaxed somewhat, but I think indiscriminate use of `private` is still discouraged.
> 
> Many of these lemmas (not all, I admit) could potentially be useful elsewhere. Maybe they're not terribly interesting, but mathlib is full of dull-but-useful lemmas. Others have one-line proofs and are only used once in the file; so they can just be in-lined where used.

Yes, I know there are a lot of `private` results. I tried to keep the proof short (well, not too long) and thus added a lot of partial results (and it's even worse in the second PR). I'll try to clean it up a bit as you suggested by making some of them public and incorporating others in the proof.
Here's some feedback on all the files except the new one (will look at the new one later). All looks very good so far!

I am not sure it is a good idea to have so many `private` declarations. When I first started contributing to mathlib, I was told that `private` was banned entirely; the rules have been relaxed somewhat, but I think indiscriminate use of `private` is still discouraged.

Many of these lemmas (not all, I admit) could potentially be useful elsewhere. Maybe they're not terribly interesting, but mathlib is full of dull-but-useful lemmas. Others have one-line proofs and are only used once in the file; so they can just be in-lined where used.

It's a pity that these theorems won't cover the case of `NNReal`, but I couldn't find a combination of typeclasses in mathlib that would apply in that case (we have "seminormed rings", but not "normed semirings"!) At some point we will probably want the version for the Int-valued floor function too, but that can come in another PR.

The converse of this is true as well, and might be useful. Can you add it? Here is a proof (might be golfable further)
```lean
theorem integrableAtFilter_rpow_atTop_iff {r : â„} :
    IntegrableAtFilter (fun x : â„ â†¦ x ^ r) atTop â†” r < -1 := by
  refine âŸ¨fun h â†¦ ?_, 
    fun hr â†¦ âŸ¨Set.Ioi 1, Ioi_mem_atTop 1, (integrableOn_Ioi_rpow_iff zero_lt_one).mpr hrâŸ©âŸ©
  obtain âŸ¨s, hs, hrâŸ© := h
  obtain âŸ¨t, htâŸ© := mem_atTop_sets.mp hs
  rw [â† integrableOn_Ioi_rpow_iff (t := max t 1)]
  Â· exact hr.mono_set <| fun x hx â†¦ ht _ <| (le_max_left t 1).trans hx.le
  Â· exact zero_lt_one.trans_le (le_max_right _ _)
```

Do you think something like the following should be added to Mathlib (with the suitable hypothesis): 
```
theorem integrableAtFilter_atTop_iff {Î± E : Type*} (f : Î± â†’ E) (Î¼ : Measure Î± := by volume_tac) :
    IntegrableAtFilter f atTop Î¼ â†” âˆƒ a, IntegrableOn f (Ioi a) Î¼ := by
```
or maybe
```
theorem integrableAtFilter_atTop_iff {Î± E : Type*} (f : Î± â†’ E) (Î¼ : Measure Î± := by volume_tac) :
    IntegrableAtFilter f atTop Î¼ â†” âˆ€á¶  a in atTop, IntegrableOn f (Ioi a) Î¼
```
I don't think that would make the proof of the `iff` statement shorter though.
Yes, I think we should definitely add one or the other; and I think the former is probably easier to apply in practice.

#21016.  

Still, I don't think that would be useful here. So I kept your proof since I couldn't do better :) Thanks!

There's a new policy that terminal simps shouldn't be squeezed, so `simp [hy]`. I also wonder whether it is maybe better for `cpow_ne_zero_iff` to be precisely the opposite of `cpow_eq_zero_iff`, i.e. `x ^ y â‰  0 â†” x â‰  0 âˆ¨ y = 0`; if you really want this exact statement, it could be called `cpow_ne_zero_iff_of_exponent_ne_zero` (very wordy, I know).
I implemented your suggestion
Without squeezing the terminal simp :)

If the theorem is to be "de-privatized", then probably it should get a slightly more specific name (`integrableOn_mul_sum_Icc_floor` perhaps?) so people don't find it by accident when searching for general analysis lemmas about integrals and sums.
I went with the slightly shorter `integrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`. I hope that's fine.
(same remark here)
Same as above, I changed the name to `locallyIntegrableOn_mul_sum_Icc`
This whole docstring is indented, please unindent

```suggestion
  `âˆ‘ k âˆˆ Icc 1 n, â€–f kâ€–` are `O(n ^ r)` for some real `0 â‰¤ r`, then the L-series `LSeries f`
```

```suggestion
  rw [LSeries.term]
  split_ifs with h <;> simp [h, hf, cpow_neg, div_eq_inv_mul]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): results involving partial sums of coefficients (part 1)

source.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): results involving partial sums of coefficients (part 2)

Here's some feedback on all the files except the new one (will look at the new one later). All looks very good so far!

I am not sure it is a good idea to have so many `private` declarations. When I first started contributing to mathlib, I was told that `private` was banned entirely; the rules have been relaxed somewhat, but I think indiscriminate use of `private` is still discouraged.

Many of these lemmas (not all, I admit) could potentially be useful elsewhere. Maybe they're not terribly interesting, but mathlib is full of dull-but-useful lemmas. Others have one-line proofs and are only used once in the file; so they can just be in-lined where used.

> I am not sure it is a good idea to have so many `private` declarations. When I first started contributing to mathlib, I was told that `private` was banned entirely; the rules have been relaxed somewhat, but I think indiscriminate use of `private` is still discouraged.
>

Yes, I know there are a lot of `private` results. I tried to keep the proof short (well, not too long) and thus added a lot of partial results (and it's even worse in the second PR). I'll try to clean it up a bit as you suggested by making some of them public and incorporating others in the proof.
